title.narrative: UNICEF: Provision of Child Protection in Emergency Services in Ghor Province

description.narrative: EMERGENCY RESPONSE: As part of this 8-month emergency response project in Ghor province, War Child UK will ensure that: - 300 children (100 girls and 200 boys) are provided with child protection services, including psychosocial support, family tracing and reunification of unaccompanied and separated children, and immediate lifesaving support to the most vulnerable children and their families. - 700 children (300 girls and 400 boys) are reached with messages on landmines and ERWs and protection issues. - 50 (25 female and 25 male) social workers, CPAN members and partners are trained on GBV prevention and risk mitigation in line with the Inter-Agency Standing Committee (IASC) GBV Guidelines. - 8 social workers (4 female and 4 male) are deployed, and their capacities are built to respond to child protection needs, particularly GBV. - GBV is mainstreamed in other sectors.
